bioghist.p: The National Clay Club was an organization of the supporters of Henry Clay for the presidential election of 1844. There were many local chapters of the Clay Club in townships and cities throughout Pennsylvania and in other states. Some of the local chapters corresponded with the National Clay Club to report on their organizing activities and membership recruitment.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume belonging to the National Clay Club. The book lists names of over 9000 Clay supporters, with the city, county, and state of residence and a date next to each name. In addition to Pennsylvania, supporters come from Maine, Massachusetts, Indiana, Missouri, Alabama, Tennessee, Vermont, Rhode Island, and Kentucky.
